intro: Zeuxine ballii, commonly known as the Kashmir Himalayan zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, with five petals, and it produces follicles as its fruit type. Zeuxine ballii is often found in meadows and on slopes, contributing to the biodiversity of its mountainous habitat.
